description: a(n) = order of the orthogonal group O_n(2) if n is odd or O^(+)_n(2) if n is even.
comments: Pseudo-Galois numbers for d=4; order of group AGL(n,2^2).
references: J. H. Conway, R. T. Curtis, S. P. Norton, R. A. Parker and R. A. Wilson, ATLAS of Finite Groups. Oxford Univ. Press, 1985, p. xii (but beware typos!).
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..40
formula: a(n) = p^n Product (p^n - p^k) for k=0 to n-1
maple: f:=proc(n,eps) local m,d;if n mod 2 = 0 then m:=n/2; d:=gcd(4,2^m-eps);2^(m*(m-1))*mul( 4^i-1, i=1..m)*(2^m-eps)/d;else m:=(n-1)/2;2^(m^2)*mul( 4^i-1, i=1..m);fi; end;[seq(f(n,+1),n=0..20)]
author: _Olivier GÃ©rard_
extensions: Entry revised by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 30 2008
